headline: India's Sun Pharma launches hair loss drug Leqselvi in US after patent settlement
summary: (Reuters) -India's top drugmaker by revenue Sun Pharma on Monday launched its anti-baldness drug Leqselvi in the U.S., following the settlement of a patent dispute with Incyte Corp.  The company said 8 mg Leqselvi tablets for severe alopecia areata will be available in the U.S., after a launch delay caused by a patent infringement case in a U.S. court.  Shrikant Akolkar, analyst at Nuvama Institutional Equities, said the drug could generate up to $400 million in sales by FY30, with peak sales potential of $900 million, and boost growth in Sun's key U.S. market.

thumbnail.caption: A bird flies past the logo of Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd. installed on the facade of its corporate office in Mumbai
